title: Scroll of butterflies
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Scroll                                                                                                  |
| :--- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Scroll of butterflies                                                                                   |
| Icon | [![Scroll of butterflies.png](/images/a/a9/Scroll_of_butterflies.png)](/File:Scroll_of_butterflies.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                                                |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A scroll that surrounds its user with a flight of beautiful butterflies, blowing back other creatures nearby with the flapping of their wings. |

Reading a **scroll of butterflies** creates a mass of friendly [butterflies](/Butterflies "Butterflies"). It will place 16-22 butterflies within a 2-tile radius from you, and 12-28 butterflies within a 5-tile radius.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) It also knocks back nearby enemies.

This scroll is [mutually exclusive](/Alternate_items "Alternate items") with the [scroll of summoning](/Scroll_of_summoning "Scroll of summoning"); only one of the two scrolls may spawn in any given game.

## Tips and Tricks

- Butterflies are great at blocking attacks and distracting enemies. Note that butterflies are [evasive](/Ev "Ev"), for better or worse. E.g. monsters with ranged weapons may miss your butterflies, hitting you anyways.
- Since the scroll blows enemies away, it allows you to disengage without facing [attacks of opportunity](/Attacks_of_opportunity "Attacks of opportunity").
- Like all summons, butterflies can be affected by a [scroll of immolation](/Scroll_of_immolation "Scroll of immolation"), but their sporadic movement means that you always run the risk of taking a few fiery explosions to the face.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), scrolls of butterflies alternated with the [scroll of fog](/Scroll_of_fog "Scroll of fog") rather than the scroll of summoning. The scroll was more common, but created fewer butterflies (10-20 butterflies total) and did not knock back enemies.
- Scrolls of butterflies were introduced in [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"). They replicate the effects of the removed spell [Summon Butterflies](/Summon_Butterflies "Summon Butterflies"), though the scroll spawns more butterflies.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-summoning.cc:1058](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/spl-summoning.cc#L1058) (0.30.0)
